Present Simple.description: Used for expressing habits, general truths, and routine actions.

grammar.name: Present Simple
uses: to talk about habits, routines, and things that are true in general
to describe actions that are happening now
to express universal truths or facts
to talk about scheduled events in the near future
examples: I get up at 7:00 am every day.

multipleChoice.question: What do you usually do on Sundays?
What _______ your parents do?
Where _______ you live?
What _______ at 8:00 am?
My sister _______ a doctor.
We _______ dinner at 7:00 pm.
Where _______ your brother study?
I _______ a book every month.
What _______ you usually do at night?
They _______ in a big house.

fillInTheBlank.question: I _______ (play) soccer every Saturday.
My mother _______ (cook) dinner every evening.
They _______ (not/have) a car.
We _______ (usually/get up) at 7:00 am.
She _______ (not/like) broccoli.
He _______ (work) as an engineer.
I _______ (usually/study) for three hours every evening.
They _______ (live) in a small apartment.
We _______ (not/have) a pet.
She _______ (usually/eat) breakfast at 8:00 am.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: What do you do on Sundays? B: I _______ (usually/watch) TV all day.
A: What does your brother do? B: He _______ (work) as a doctor.
A: Where do you live? B: I _______ (live) in a small house.
A: What do you usually do at night? B: I _______ (usually/read) a book.
A: What does your sister do? B: She _______ (work) as a teacher.
A: Do you like pizza? B: Yes, I _______ (love) pizza.
A: How often do you exercise? B: I _______ (usually/exercise) three times a week.
A: What does your father do? B: He _______ (work) as a lawyer.
A: Where do you usually go on vacation? B: I _______ (usually/go) to the beach.
A: What do you usually eat for breakfast? B: I _______ (usually/eat) cereal.

Present Continuous.description: Describes actions that are happening right now or around the current period.

uses: to talk about actions that are happening now
to talk about temporary or changing situations
to talk about trends or current events
to talk about annoying habits or repeated actions

examples.sentence: I am studying for my exam right now.
examples.explanation: talking about an action happening now

examples.sentence: They are building a new hospital in our city.
examples.explanation: talking about a temporary or changing situation

examples.sentence: She is always leaving her dirty dishes for me to clean.
examples.explanation: talking about an annoying habit

multipleChoice.question: What ______________ (do) at 8 o'clock tonight?
My parents ______________ (not allow) me to go to the party.
What ______________ (you, do) when I called you yesterday?
They ______________ (just, finish) their project when the deadline was extended.
We ______________ (never, attend) a concert like that before.
My sister ______________ (usually, get up) at 7 am.
What ______________ (you, do) at the moment?
They ______________ (currently, work) on a new project.
We ______________ (not, like) this weather.
She ______________ (just, start) her new job last week.

fillInTheBlank.question: I ______________ a glass of water because I'm thirsty.
My parents ______________ me to clean my room every week.
We ______________ a party at our house tonight.
She ______________ her hair because it's too long.
They ______________ their holidays in Hawaii every year.
I ______________ my homework while watching TV.
We ______________ to the gym three times a week.
He ______________ his favorite video game right now.
They ______________ a new restaurant in our neighborhood.
She ______________ her favorite book for the third time.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: What are you doing right now? B: I ______________ (write) an email to my boss.
A: What's happening? B: There ______________ (be) a protest in the city center.
A: Why are you so tired? B: I ______________ (not, sleep) well last night.
A: What's your sister doing? B: She ______________ (study) for her exam right now.
A: Do you like this weather? B: No, I ______________ (not, like) it at all.
A: What are they doing? B: They ______________ (build) a new house next door.
A: Why are you so hungry? B: I ______________ (not, eat) lunch today.
A: What's your brother doing? B: He ______________ (play) soccer with his friends.
A: Are you free tonight? B: No, I ______________ (go) to a concert.
A: What's happening? B: There ______________ (be) a sale at the mall.

Past Simple.description: Used for actions that were completed in the past at a specific time.

uses: To talk about completed actions in the past
To describe past habits
To show a cause and effect in the past
structure: Subject + did not + Verb (base form) + Object

examples.sentence: I went to the movies last night.
examples.explanation: Completed action in the past

examples.sentence: My parents lived in Paris when I was a child.
examples.explanation: Past habit

examples.sentence: I got tired because I didn't sleep well.
examples.explanation: Cause and effect in the past

multipleChoice.question: What did you __________ (do) yesterday?
She __________ (not/be) at home when I phoned.
They __________ (play) tennis when it started raining.
What __________ (you/do) at 8 o'clock last night?
My parents __________ (never/let) me stay out late.
I __________ (not/see) that movie before.
She __________ (just/finish) her homework when I called.
They __________ (not/be) married when they met.
What __________ (you/eat) for breakfast yesterday?
My sister __________ (not/pass) her exam last year.

fillInTheBlank.question: By the time I __________ (get) home, it was midnight.
If I __________ (not/spend) so much money, I would have enough to travel.
By the time they __________ (finish) their project, it was already dark.
I wish I __________ (not/tell) him about my plans.
By the time we __________ (arrive), the party had already started.
If it __________ (rain), we would have gone to the beach.
By the time I __________ (learn) how to drive, I was 18.
I wish I __________ (not/forget) my umbrella at home.
By the time they __________ (eat), they were starving.
If I __________ (not/be) so tired, I would have gone to the gym.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: What did you do yesterday? B: I __________ to the park with my friends.
A: Did you see the movie last night? B: No, I __________ to the cinema.
A: What time did you get up this morning? B: I __________ at 7 o'clock.
A: Did you like the book? B: Yes, I __________ it last week.
A: Why were you late? B: I __________ traffic on the way here.
A: What did you do when you __________ the news? B: I was shocked.
A: Did you visit Paris last year? B: No, I __________ to Rome instead.
A: What did you eat for breakfast? B: I __________ toast and eggs.
A: Did you go to the party? B: No, I __________ at home.
A: How did you get to the airport? B: I __________ a taxi.

Past Continuous.description: Describes actions that were in progress at a specific moment in the past.

uses: to describe an action that was in progress at a specific point in the past
to show that one action was in progress when another action started
to express an action that was interrupted by another action

examples.sentence: I was studying for my exam at 8 pm last night.
examples.explanation: Describing an action that was in progress at a specific point in the past

examples.sentence: They were having a party when I arrived.
examples.explanation: Showing that one action was in progress when another action started

examples.sentence: I was writing an email when the power went out.
examples.explanation: Expressing an action that was interrupted by another action

multipleChoice.question: What was I _______ at 10 pm last night?
They _______ dinner when I arrived.
I _______ my homework when the phone rang.
What _______ you _______ at 8 am yesterday?
She _______ her hair when I saw her.
We _______ a meeting when the fire alarm went off.
He _______ his car when it broke down.
They _______ a new house when they got married.
What _______ you _______ at 5 pm yesterday?
I _______ my project when my friend came over.

fillInTheBlank.question: I ____________________ (study) for my exam when my mother called.
They ____________________ (have) a party when I arrived.
I ____________________ (write) an email when the power went out.
What ____________________ (you, do) at 10 pm last night?
She ____________________ (do) her homework when I saw her.
We ____________________ (have) a meeting when the fire alarm went off.
He ____________________ (wash) his car when it broke down.
They ____________________ (build) a new house when they got married.
What ____________________ (you, do) at 5 pm yesterday?
I ____________________ (work) on my project when my friend came over.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: What were you doing at 10 pm last night? B: I ____________________.
A: How did you get to know each other? B: We ____________________.
A: Why did you stop playing the game? B: I ____________________.
A: What were you doing when the power went out? B: I ____________________.
A: What were you doing at 5 pm yesterday? B: I ____________________.
A: How did you learn how to play the guitar? B: I ____________________.
A: Why did you stop working on your project? B: I ____________________.
A: What were you doing when the phone rang? B: I ____________________.
A: What were you doing at 8 am yesterday? B: I ____________________.
A: How did you meet your friend? B: We ____________________.
dialogueCompletion.answer: were studying in the same class

Future Simple.description: Used for expressing promises, predictions, and spontaneous decisions about the future.

grammar.name: Future Simple
grammar.description: Used to talk about actions that will happen in the future.
uses: To talk about future plans or intentions
To predict future events or trends
To express uncertainty or doubt about the future
structure: Subject + will + base form of the verb

examples.sentence: I will attend the meeting tomorrow.
examples.explanation: I plan to attend the meeting tomorrow.

examples.sentence: It will rain tomorrow.
examples.explanation: I predict that it will rain tomorrow.

examples.sentence: She will probably pass the exam.
examples.explanation: I think she will probably pass the exam, but I'm not sure.

multipleChoice.question: What will you do tomorrow?
options: I will go to the park
multipleChoice.answer: I will go to the park

multipleChoice.question: By next year, I ______________ my degree.
They ______________ their new house next month.
If it ______________ cold, we will go skiing.
By the time I ______________ my homework, it will be midnight.
I think it ______________ snow this winter.
She ______________ her new job next week.
By next year, they ______________ their business for five years.
If it ______________ sunny, we will go to the beach.
I ______________ my driving test next month.

fillInTheBlank.question: By the time I ______________ my degree, I will be 25 years old.
If it ______________ cold, we will go skiing tomorrow.
I ______________ my new phone next week.
She ______________ her new job next month.
They ______________ their new house next year.
I think it ______________ snow this winter.
By next year, I ______________ my business for 10 years.
If it ______________ sunny, we will go to the beach.
I ______________ my driving test next month.
They ______________ their wedding next summer.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: What will you do tomorrow? B: ______________
options: I will go to the park
dialogueCompletion.answer: I will go to the park

dialogueCompletion.question: A: By next year, I ______________ my degree. B: Congratulations!
A: They ______________ their new house next month. B: That's great!
A: If it ______________ cold, we will go skiing. B: I love skiing!
A: By the time I ______________ my homework, it will be midnight. B: That's too late!
A: I think it ______________ snow this winter. B: I hope so!
A: She ______________ her new job next week. B: Good luck!
A: By next year, they ______________ their business for five years. B: That's amazing!
A: If it ______________ sunny, we will go to the beach. B: Sounds like fun!
A: I ______________ my driving test next month. B: Good luck!

Future Continuous.description: Describes actions that will be in progress at a specific time in the future.

grammar.Description: The Future Continuous tense is used to describe an action that will be in progress at a specific point in the future.
uses: To describe an action that will be in progress at a specific point in the future
To show that an action will continue up to a specific point in the future
To express an action that is planned or scheduled for a specific time in the future
To talk about an action that will be interrupted by another action

examples.sentence: I will be studying for my exam at 8pm tonight.
examples.explanation: Here, the speaker is describing an action that will be in progress at a specific point in the future (8pm tonight).

examples.sentence: They will be living in Paris by next year.
examples.explanation: Here, the speaker is describing an action that will continue up to a specific point in the future (next year).

examples.sentence: We will be attending the conference at 2pm tomorrow.
examples.explanation: Here, the speaker is expressing an action that is planned or scheduled for a specific time in the future (2pm tomorrow).

multipleChoice.question: What will you be doing at 9am tomorrow?
By next year, ____________________ English for three years.
What will you be doing at 7pm tonight?
By the time I arrive, ____________________ their party for an hour.
At 9am, ____________________ an important meeting.
What will you be doing at 10am tomorrow?
options: I will go to the gym
I will be going to the gym
I will go to the gym
multipleChoice.answer: I will be going to the gym

multipleChoice.question: At 6pm, ____________________ my favorite TV show.
By next year, ____________________ my degree.

fillInTheBlank.question: By next year, I ____________________ English for three years.
What will you be doing at 7pm tonight? I ____________________ a movie.
At 10am, they ____________________ a meeting.
By the time I arrive, they ____________________ their party for an hour.
What will you be doing at 10am tomorrow? I ____________________ my homework.
At 6pm, they ____________________ a concert.
By next year, I ____________________ my master's degree.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: What will you be doing at 7pm tonight? B: I ____________________ a movie.
A: At 10am, what will you be doing? B: I ____________________ a meeting.
A: What will you be doing at 9am tomorrow? B: I ____________________ an exam.
A: By next year, what will you be doing? B: I ____________________ my degree.
A: At 8pm, what will you be doing? B: I ____________________ dinner.
A: What will you be doing at 6pm tonight? B: I ____________________ a concert.
A: By next year, what will you be doing? B: I ____________________ English for three years.
A: At 10am, what will you be doing? B: I ____________________ my homework.
A: What will you be doing at 9am tomorrow? B: I ____________________ breakfast.
A: By next year, what will you be doing? B: I ____________________ my master's degree.

Future Perfect.description: Indicates that an action will have been completed before a specific future time.

grammar.name: Future Perfect
grammar.description: The Future Perfect tense is used to describe an action that will be completed at a specific point in the future.
uses: To describe an action that will be finished at a specific point in the future.
To show that one action will be completed before another action starts in the future.
To express completion of an action by a specific time in the future.
structure: Subject + will not have + past participle

examples.sentence: I will have finished my homework by then.
examples.explanation: I will complete my homework by a specific point in the future.

examples.sentence: They will have learned the language by the time they graduate.
examples.explanation: They will complete learning the language before they graduate.

examples.sentence: She will have saved enough money by next year.
examples.explanation: She will have completed saving enough money by next year.

multipleChoice.question: By next year, I ____________________ my degree.
By the time I arrive, they ____________________ their project.
By the end of the year, I ____________________ 10 books.
By 2030, the company ____________________ 10 years in business.
By the time I graduate, I ____________________ my thesis.
By next month, I ____________________ my driving test.
By the end of the decade, we ____________________ a new house.
By 2027, I ____________________ my Master's degree.
By the time I retire, I ____________________ 40 years of service.

fillInTheBlank.question: By next year, I ____________________ my Ph.D.
By the time I arrive, they ____________________ their party.
By 2025, humans ____________________ to the moon 10 times.
By the end of the year, I ____________________ 500 hours of community service.
By 2030, the company ____________________ 15 years in business.
By the time I graduate, I ____________________ my thesis.
By next month, I ____________________ my driving test.
By the end of the decade, we ____________________ a new house.
By 2027, I ____________________ my Master's degree.
By the time I retire, I ____________________ 40 years of service.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: By next year, I will have ____________________ my degree. B: Congratulations!
A: By the time I arrive, they will have ____________________ their party. B: I'm excited!
A: By 2025, humans will have ____________________ to Mars. B: That's amazing!
A: By the end of the year, I will have ____________________ 10 books. B: You're a fast reader!
A: By 2030, the company will have ____________________ 10 years in business. B: Congratulations!
A: By the time I graduate, I will have ____________________ my thesis. B: Good luck!
A: By next month, I will have ____________________ my driving test. B: You'll do great!
A: By the end of the decade, we will have ____________________ a new house. B: That's exciting!
A: By 2027, I will have ____________________ my Master's degree. B: Congratulations!
A: By the time I retire, I will have ____________________ 40 years of service. B: That's impressive!

Present Perfect.description: It describes actions completed in the past or that began in the past and are still ongoing.

uses: To show that an action started in the past and continues up to the present
To show that an action happened at an unspecified time in the past and has a connection to the present
To show that an action has a result in the present

examples.sentence: I have lived in Paris for three years.
examples.explanation: The action of living in Paris started in the past and continues up to the present.

examples.sentence: She has just finished her homework.
examples.explanation: The action of finishing homework happened at an unspecified time in the past and has a connection to the present.

examples.sentence: They have never been to the United States.
examples.explanation: The action of going to the United States has a result in the present (they have not been there yet).

multipleChoice.question: I ______________ to the gym three times this week.
She ______________ her new job for three months.
They ______________ to the party last night.
We ______________ our homework yet.
It ______________ since morning.
I ______________ to the store yet.
They ______________ their car for five years.
We ______________ the movie twice.
She ______________ her breakfast yet.
It ______________ 10 years since I graduated from college.

fillInTheBlank.question: I __________________ to the gym three times this week.
She __________________ her new job for three months.
They __________________ to the party last night.
We __________________ our homework yet.
It __________________ since morning.
I __________________ to the store yet.
They __________________ their car for five years.
We __________________ the movie twice.
She __________________ her breakfast yet.
It __________________ 10 years since I graduated from college.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: How long have you been studying English? B: I __________________ English for five years.
A: What have you done today? B: I __________________ my homework and now I'm watching TV.
A: Have you ever been to Paris? B: Yes, I __________________ there twice.
A: How long has it taken you to finish your project? B: I __________________ it for three months.
A: What have you eaten for lunch? B: I __________________ a sandwich and a salad.
A: Have you seen the new movie? B: Yes, I __________________ it twice.
A: How long have you known your friend? B: I __________________ him since childhood.
A: What have you been doing since morning? B: I __________________ my homework and now I'm tired.
A: Have you ever traveled to Asia? B: Yes, I __________________ to China twice.
A: How long has your sister been studying medicine? B: She __________________ medicine for five years.

Past Perfect.description: Shows that an action was completed before another action occurred in the past.

uses: To show that one action was completed before another action in the past
To show that one action had a connection to another action in the past
To show that one action was the cause of another action in the past
structure: Had + Past Participle (e.g., I had eaten)
Had not + Past Participle (e.g., I had not eaten)

examples.sentence: I had eaten lunch before I went to the park.
examples.explanation: The action of eating lunch was completed before going to the park.

examples.sentence: She had studied English for three years before she moved to the US.
examples.explanation: The action of studying English was completed before moving to the US.

examples.sentence: They had never been to Paris before they went last year.
examples.explanation: The action of never having been to Paris was completed before going last year.

multipleChoice.question: I __________ my homework before I went to bed.
By the time I arrived, they __________ their dinner.
If I __________ more money, I would have bought the car.
By 2010, I __________ in New York for five years.
They __________ their project before the deadline.
I __________ my exam before I went on vacation.
By the time I arrived, they __________ their party.
If I __________ more experience, I would have gotten the job.
I __________ my homework before I played video games.
They __________ their house by the time we arrived.

fillInTheBlank.question: By the time I arrived, they ____________________ their dinner.
I ____________________ my homework before I went to bed.
If I ____________________ more money, I would have bought the car.

They ____________________ their project before the deadline.
I ____________________ my exam before I went on vacation.
By the time I arrived, they ____________________ their party.
If I ____________________ more experience, I would have gotten the job.
I ____________________ my homework before I played video games.
They ____________________ their house by the time we arrived.

A: I'm sorry I'm late. B: It's okay. I ____________________ (not/finish) my work yet.

A: I'm full. B: I know. You ____________________ (eat) a big meal.
A: I'm excited. B: Me too. We ____________________ (just/win) the game.

Future Perfect Continuous.description: Emphasizes the duration of an action that will be in progress up until a point in the future.

uses: to talk about an action that will be in progress at a specific point in the future and will continue up to that point
to show that an action will have a connection with another action in the future
to emphasize the duration of an action leading up to a point in the future
structure: Subject + will not have been + verb-ing

examples.sentence: By next year, I will have been studying English for five years.
examples.explanation: I will have been studying English for five years by next year, and I will still be studying it.

examples.sentence: By the time I arrive, they will have been waiting for two hours.
examples.explanation: When I arrive, they will have been waiting for two hours, and they may be frustrated.

examples.sentence: By the end of next month, I will have been working on this project for six months.
examples.explanation: By the end of next month, I will have been working on this project for six months, and I may be close to finishing it.

multipleChoice.question: By next year, I ____________________ English for five years.
By the time I arrive, they ____________________ for two hours.
By the end of next month, I ____________________ on this project for six months.

By the end of this year, I ____________________ my degree for two years.
By next month, we ____________________ our new business for six months.
By the time I retire, I ____________________ in the company for 30 years.
By next year, my friends ____________________ in their new apartment for a year.

fillInTheBlank.question: By next year, I ____________________ English for five years.

A: By next year, my friends ____________________ in their new apartment for a year. B: They must be settled in by now.

Past Perfect Continuous.description: Highlights the duration of an action that was in progress before another event in the past.

uses: To describe an action that started before a specific point in the past and continued up to that point
To show cause and effect between two past actions
To emphasize the duration of an action before another past action

examples.sentence: I had been studying English for three years before I moved to the US.
examples.explanation: Describing an action that started before a specific point in the past and continued up to that point

examples.sentence: By the time I arrived, they had been waiting for two hours.
examples.explanation: Showing cause and effect between two past actions

examples.sentence: By 2010, I had been working on this project for five years.
examples.explanation: Emphasizing the duration of an action before another past action

multipleChoice.question: By the time I arrived, they ____________________ for two hours.
I ____________________ for a job for six months before I got hired.
By 2015, I ____________________ my bachelor's degree for three years.
They ____________________ to each other for hours before they finally made up.
By the time I left, I ____________________ my essay for five hours.
They ____________________ for their trip for weeks before they finally left.
I ____________________ my guitar for three years before I gave up.
By the time I arrived, they ____________________ their project for months.
I ____________________ to the gym every day for a year before I got tired of it.
They ____________________ to the beach every summer for ten years before they moved away.

I ____________________ for a job for six months before I got hired.

They ____________________ for their trip for weeks before they finally left.
I ____________________ my guitar for three years before I gave up.
By the time I arrived, they ____________________ their project for months.
I ____________________ to the gym every day for a year before I got tired of it.
They ____________________ to the beach every summer for ten years before they moved away.

dialogueCompletion.question: A: How long did it take you to finish your project? B: I ____________________ on it for three months before I finally finished it.
A: Why are you so tired? B: I ____________________ all night before the exam.
A: How long did you know each other before you got married? B: We ____________________ for five years before we got married.
A: What were you doing before you moved to New York? B: I ____________________ in California for three years before I moved to New York.
A: How long did it take you to learn how to play the piano? B: I ____________________ for ten years before I finally mastered it.

Present Perfect Continuous.description: The Present Perfect Continuous tense highlights the duration of an action from the past to the present.

uses: To describe an action that started in the past and is still ongoing
To show that an action has been in progress for a specific period of time
To emphasize the duration of an activity up to now

examples.sentence: I have been studying English for three years.
examples.explanation: The studying began three years ago and is still continuing.

examples.sentence: She has been working on her project for six months.
examples.explanation: The working started six months ago and is still in progress.

examples.sentence: They have been living in Paris for five years.
examples.explanation: The living situation began five years ago and remains true.

multipleChoice.question: I ________________ (study) English for three years.
Right now, I ________________ (work) on a challenging project.
My sister ________________ (live) in London for six months.
I ________________ (not/talk) to my colleague for ages.
How long ________________ (you/learn) English?
I ________________ (not/eat) breakfast for five days.
She ________________ (teach) at the university for ten years.
They ________________ (not/travel) abroad for five years.

fillInTheBlank.question: I ____________________ (study) English for three years.
Right now, I ____________________ (work) on a challenging project.
My sister ____________________ (live) in London for six months.
I ____________________ (not/talk) to my colleague for ages.
How long ____________________ (you/learn) English?
I ____________________ (not/eat) breakfast for five days.
She ____________________ (teach) at the university for ten years.
They ____________________ (not/travel) abroad for five years.

dialogueCompletion.question:
A: How long have you been learning to play the guitar? 
B: I ____________________ (learn) for three years.

A: How's your project going? 
B: I ____________________ (work) on it for six months.

A: Have you spoken with Sarah lately? 
B: No, I ____________________ (not/talk) to her for ages.

A: How long have you been studying for your exams? 
B: I ____________________ (study) for several weeks.

A: How's your new job going? 
B: I ____________________ (work) there for a few months now.

A: Have you been eating well lately? 
B: Yes, I ____________________ (eat) healthy meals every day.

A: How long have they been teaching at that school? 
B: They ____________________ (teach) there for over five years.

A: Why are you so tired? 
B: I ____________________ (not/sleep) well recently.
